comments:
OS: Windows XP with Locale set to Arabic.
Must Fix: Yes
Blocking: Yes
Build Date: 0523
Component: TPTP
Language: AR
Tester Name: Omar Bahy

Scenario:
1- Place eclipse in a path that includes Arabic characters.
2- Try to open "Profiling and logging" Perspective.

Problem:
-Error is generated and the profile dose Not open.  Log file attached.

Note:
The problem dose not exist as long as the path dose not contain Arabic characters.

This article was reassigned from Category:''TVT/Testing''.

Created an attachment (id=42498)
Log.txt

<cde:tctdetail>
Testcase: 27.001000 TPTP -TVT.MONITOR.UI.IMPORTLOGWIZARD_1.1
Project: WSW32
Component: CDE - TPTP/Platform UI
Priority: 1
Subject: AR: TPTP: Opening Profiling and Logging perspective.
Article ID: 700
Originator: ROUSHDY@EG.IBM.COM
</cde:tctdetail>

This is a very weird problem. I tried all the following combinations and they all work but only fails in the scenario specified.

working scenarios
AR machine - english workbench (english path)
AR machine - english workbench RTL (english path)
AR machine - AR workbench (english path)
AR machine - AR workbench RTL (english path)

failing scenario
AR machine - AR workbench (path containing AR wording)
Moving to the execution component as the stack trace points to the o.e.h.execution plugin

Created an attachment (id=43136)
Standalone test case

Here is a standalone test case to validate JAXP parsing capability.

Test #1:
java -classpath 143596.jar Bug143596 <fully qualified English path to any XML file>

Test #2:
java -classpath 143596.jar Bug143596 <fully qualified Arabic path to any XML file>

Please post the results from the two test case above. Thanks.
Warning: Unable to attach 143596.jar due to unsupported extension (jar) on the filename.

Created an attachment (id=43149)
Zip of the test case jar

Here it is, a zipped up version.
Can you run the sample test case? Thanks.

It is confirmed to be a JRE limitation. The JAXP parser from the JRE does not support Arabic (as well as Traditional Chinese which I ran the test case on). Here is the output I got when running the attached test case on a Traditional Chinese Windows 2000 machine using IBM JDK 1.4.2:

E:\TestDrivers>java -classpath 143596.jar Bug143596 E:\TestDrivers\???IRAC4.1??
?{\config\serviceconfig.xml
java.net.MalformedURLException: unknown protocol: e
        at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:572)
        at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:462)
        at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:411)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLEntityManager.setupCurrentEntity(Unknown So
urce)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLVersionDetector.determineDocVersion(Unknown
 Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderImpl.parse(Unknown Source)
        at javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder.parse(Unknown Source)
        at Bug143596.test01(Bug143596.java:28)
        at Bug143596.main(Bug143596.java:15)

Therefore I will mark this as invalid due to JRE limitation.

E:\TestDrivers>java -classpath 143596.jar Bug143596 E:\TestDrivers\???IRAC4.1??
?{\config\serviceconfig.xml

I am reopening the defect so we can keep track of this problem.  Please lower the severity as you see fit.  Such a problem should be documented in release notes, and hopefuly can be corrected in future releases.
Lowering the severity as per instruction from reporter.
Hi. Can anyone from TVT test confirm if this is just an Arabic problem? Is this also happening on other languages such as those DBCS ones? We need to clarify this in the release note. Thanks.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 145856 ***

This defect should be kept in Open state until it is fixed.

This defect is NOT a dublicate of 145856.
Retarget to 4.3
Not containable in 4.3 and retarget to 4.4. Please let me know if you have any concern.
Please make sure the bug is fixed at entry of 4.4. Thank you.
Will re-investigate when JRE's JAXP supports Arabic.
Hi Bing. I have transferred my bugs to you for triage. Thanks.
